title: How am I not allowed to defend myself?
body: Just got a 14 days ban. How? The Draven in my team began flaming almost everyone and all the others allowed him to pick on them but not me, I VERBALLY defended myself against this toxic moron and I get punished. He wanted to be a tough guy and he thinks he has some kind of power. He has no power over me and I gave him what he deserved. Seriously the system is f*cked, this isn't kindergarten this is a game jesus christ. Why would I EVER allow a toxic asshole to have some kind of power over me? The system benefits toxic people so those of us that aren't toxic get banned so you have nothing but toxicity left. I have NEVER flamed players who are playing badly and/or feeds, never. I only flame people who flame others or me.

replies.body:
Defense does not involve repeating what they said or lowering yourself to a standard which would get you punished.

You have one way to "defend" yourself against chat: Mute. This is the 100% perfect defense, absolutely unbeatable by the aggressor.

If you must, you can calmly respond in a manner that doesn't violate the ToS you agreed to. I have done this from time to time, and can safely say it doesn't get you punished.

By muting him, he wins. The still gets the satisfaction of flaming everyone else. I wanted to end that satisfaction for him. If I respond in a calmly manner he'll believe that I'm somehow scared of him and scared of speaking up so he'll just continue on. Perhaps I learned him a lesson by fighting back that he shouldn't be picking on others.

> [{quoted}](name=Homegody,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=0P3rUdEk,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2018-08-26T15:17:34.928+0000)

He wins what?

These people have now gotten your account to the point on the verge of perm ban. SOMEHOW you think that makes you winning and them losing.

You know what lesson teaches people flame isn't appropriate? Muting, reporting and seeing them complaining about bans on the board.

He *wants* an audience. You give it to him when you respond, but you could have deprived him of that by muting him. You simply helped him "win" more - *particularly* if he got an instant feedback notification that you got punished.

I don't see why you associate calm with "scared", since scared people are rarely calm. If anything, I've used calm responses to convey "superior", "unimpressed", or "indifferent".

>By muting him, he wins. 

he wins what? an internet chat based flame war?

good for him! you have a game to play meanwhile. best get to it...

>Perhaps I learned him a lesson by fighting back that he shouldn't be picking on others.

you have too high expectations of your chat based drama

Hmm .. ok, that's an interesting mindset. Just because you walk away from a fight doesn't mean you are the weak one.

You are only the weak one when you think you are the weak one. Mute him and thing you are the smart one and you'll feel infinitely better.

He won

Haven't you ever heard the phrase "don't feed the trolls"? It's been a popular internet mantra for at least what, fifteen or twenty years?

Your logic is completely backwards. There's no satisfaction gained by flaming somebody. The satisfaction they're looking for, and the satisfaction you're giving them, is in the negative reactions they're able to provoke out of you. Muting IS the correct response.
No, they hate negative reactions. They want no reactions, that's how they know they succeeded.
That's backwards. Trolls always want a reaction.
I'm not sure this guy was a troll. Just a random toxic player who believes he's superior to the rest of us.
And that's exactly what they want - you to flame them back. You flaming them feeds their ego because it shows them that they**can** get to you.
anyone that understands how the system works *wants* you to shit talk them, because then you get a ban.

so you followed up his petty shallow ego with your own petty shallow ego and got in trouble for it.

Sounds about right.
Good Riddance.

You are allowed to defend yourself. Muting the offender is one way of doing that.

You are not allowed to retaliate or to add any negativity or toxicity to the game.

You might want to think this through before making such claims.

What power did he have over you?

It seems to me he had no power until you decided to retaliate with flame. You then gave him power over the only thing relevant to this game, your account.

I know exactly what's going through his mind while he's flaming everyone. He believies he's better than everyone else, especially since he was fed. If everyone are afraid to flame back then he has power over them regardless.

You have no idea what is going through his mind. You ASSUME his motive. What exactly in your flaming do you think changed his mind to think he wasn't better then you (assuming you assumption is correct)?

Also, where in the TOS or the summoners code does it say retaliating with flame is allowed? 

The truth is you let your ego pull you down to the level of something you obviously thought was objectable. Your ego caused you to violate terms you agreed to adhere to in order to play said game.

> Also, where in the TOS or the summoners code does it say retaliating with flame is allowed?

It doesn't, that's why I'm complaining. There should be a difference between "flaming" and retaliate with "flame".

Also, you can talk about ego all you want but all I did was defending myself and my fellow teammates from a toxic player.

Well it seems your defense was inadequate. As far as I know, he is still playing. Whereas, you are banned and your other three teammates dealt with two flaming teammates.

Odd concept of defense.

there's no such thing as defending yourself in game chat. you aren't in danger from their words and flaming back doesn't protect you from anything. he only thing that is in any form in danger is your ego. nothing else. muting is the actual self defence

zero tolerance. 

The system doens't look at other players, just at your own and no reasons exclude you from the rules of the game. Defending yourself is one thing but if you got banned it means you were being toxic, swearing or verbally abusing others which is against the rules no matter what. In addition that that you are blatantly lying about your behavior, the 14 day ban is  a third offense of toxic behavior meaning you've already had two punishments that total up to 35 games of chat restriction.

Another note that i'd like to make is that your defense is that you didn't want to let the guy have power over you but in fact he did, as you verbally fought back and gave him the satisfaction of getting a reaction out of you, you let him win. He had enough power over you to make you lash out at him instead of ignoring him. You lashed out and got punished for it. 

In advance when you meet people like this online, simply ignore them or laugh as you'll report them after the game but in responding back and lashing out, risking your own account all you do is let in and let him win.

No. 14 days ban is a the second offense. The first offence was exactly the same scenario with a toxic asshole who I flamed when I was defending myself. The satisfaction these people get are by having the power over the others in the game. If they don't fight back then he has that power and that's where his satisfaction comes from. And when I fight back he doesn't get that satisfaction so he cryes out that he'll report me for flaming.

Fine, if you choose to believe that its on you though please consider that keeping up with this behavior will result in more bans. If you encounter these people just tone them out as fighting will cause you more trouble than its worth, trust me.

I can't help myself. I'm not particularly upset that I got banned ((a little perhaps) I have multiple smurfs) I'm just upset that the system works in this way where toxicity is rewarded and verbally defending yourself is punished.

Yes you are.
Screenshot your reform cards and post them and I'll tell you how.
The sad thing is, the Draven who was doing all the flaming probably never got punished. The system is designed to protect the trolls, and punish those who retaliate. Working as intended.
